reviews.review_msg:
1. Go to lecture 
2. Go to tutorial 
3. Spam the problem sets while understanding the concepts 
4. Exams are easy if you do problem sets and practice final and clicker questions
5. This class WILL be scaled average typically sits low so dont feel discouraged
Had this prof for 281 and 282. No complaints

CHEM 282- dr. somers was one of the best o chem professors. i was really scared for o chem 2 but this class was not that bad, only if you are studying and doing additional problems to mkae sure you get the concepts. the midterm and final were fair, no tricks, everything was based on what she taught you :)

This is for chem 282: did NOT scale even though the avg was LOW AND its intercession. did not tell us how many questions would be on exams/ not allow questions to be asked during exams! exams were not difficult but with the short amount of time given she makes them purposefully difficult.
I was so scared for ochem but prof somers made it a breeze! Especially her tests, no tricks the final was pretty tough though emphasis on mechanisms but keep practicing and don't fall behind

orgo isnt an easy class but her lectures made everything super clear and they were super helpful. problem sets had questions that were somewhat harder than the questions she would go through in class. theres a quiz every week in tutorial but its super chill as long as you understood the problem set. great prof
Wish her problem sets would show the steps, not always clear how she got the answer. Explains concepts well. Intimidating for face-face interaction.

Orgo is not an easy course. Honestly I did find it a bit hard. But having Patricia as a prof really helped it ease down a bit cuz she's nice and takes her time to explain content. I did find notes and problem sets a bit less difficult than exam questions tho and struggled to do well on them.

She needs to work on her attitude, NOT approachable at all, I understand most OCHEM profs are bad and people like patty, but honestly not a fan of her at all. Wish she would do more practice questions, she teaches the material but gives situation we weren't taught.

Really great prof, notes/slides were clear and gave a lot of in-lecture participation and explained answers well. tutorial assignments were also very useful. Go to class and tutorial and do the work. Practice midterms and final were very similar to actual exam.

Dr. Somers explains chemistry clearly and thoroughly. Her lectures contain simple definitions and many examples to solidify her students' understanding. There is a fair amount of homework, but it is very helpful in aiding student understanding. 

Between her lectures and assigned homework, you will find no surprises on the exams. 

10/10 prof.
W prof.

Definitely one of my favourite profs. Her lectures were very clear and she provided many practice problems for each chapter. Her exams were very fair and relatively similar to practice. Labs were pretty fun and easy as you're given lots of time and can talk about the lab report with the people around you (unlike both gen chems). Great prof!

Wouldn't recommend her for the chem281 lectures, as for lab, TAs make or break your lab and I'm so glad I had a supportive TA that was there to help when the prof wasn't. Try avoiding her unless you want to teach urself the course concepts. online textbook doesnt teach jack even though it's required readings + problems ( waste of money +time)
Great prof! She was very caring and wanted her students to succeed. OChem was a hard class no matter who you take it with. Her exams were fair with no suprizes.

Dr. Somers is one of the best ochem profs you can get. Explains very clearly, exams are fair, very accessible and explains everything well. Put in the work and you will do well. Labs were fun and you're given plenty of resources to practice everything.

If you don't take her as your 281 prof, you are going to miss out. Her lectures are going to be extremely clear, and allows you to understand the materials EVEN better, on the premise that you have read the topic beforehand! The course will heavily depend on how well you understand all the textbook materials she gives you.
Very polite and willing to help, do lots of practice questions and you will be fine. Exams are fair.

Prof Somers is really great, in fact one of the best organic chem profs there are; she teaches you everything you need to know very clearly and is accessible outside of class. Exams are fair. If you put in the work, you will do very well in this class.
Nice and polite.

Prof Somers was an amazing professor that I had. Her lectures are so clear and are also accessible at the canvas. And the best part is that she takes 3 midterms and drops the one lowest score.  Also, she is very polite and accessible outside the classroom. Her exams are a bit hard but if you follow along, you will be able to to good.
Really enjoyed Prof Somers, her exams were difficult but fair. She was always available during office hours.

Her lectures are so unclear and always explains things in the most unclear way possible. She talks with a lot of hesitation and mumbling its hard to follow. You dont know what the lecture will even be about because her notes are empty and you only have an ambiguous heading as insight. Not a good setup for an orgo class.
